result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse D. Pietrzak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesse D. Pietrzak in court with attorney Anne Renc. ADA Cass Cousins appearing on behalf of Louis John Molepske for the State of Wisconsin.

**8:38 a.m.  Court informs Defendant(s) in Courtroom of Constitutional Rights if they plead either guilty or no contest. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge and maximum penalties.

9:11  a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 30 day jail sentence
If probation is revoked:  Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling or any other reasons the sheriff will allow.
Second half can be completed on home monitor if approved by assessment  
Placed on probation for 12 months
**Conditions of Probation:
Pay $100 fine plus costs and surcharges (DNA)
Provide DNA sample 
Complete 30 hours of community service
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Attend and comply with a parenting class.
Participate in any counseling and assessments as recommended by the agent.
No contact with the child if defendant has been drinking

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesse D. Pietrzak appeared by video. Attorney Anne Renc in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Notify Clerk of Courts with any change of address.  Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *D.M.P 12/29/2010*   Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.   Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *5 days per week, when regularly open*

Defendant Jesse D. Pietrzak appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Louis Molepske appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Atty Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Atty Molepske states that the criminal complaint has just been filed.

2:41 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Defendant is urepresented, does not have counsel.

State has filed a criminal complaint.
Atty Molepske states his office will be taking a copy of the complaint to Defendant.

Court takes a moment to review the criminal complaint.

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Defendant talked to someone from the public defender's office today.
Matter will be adjourned.
Court will reserve the entry of a plea so attorney may be present

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: August 17, 2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3

Defendant is self employed, handy man service.
Court continues questioning Defendant.

Court verifies Defendant's address.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court regarding bond, signature bond with conditions.

Court orders bond, addresses the Defendant.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
